FILE NAME:      KVINT

DATE MODIFIED:  August 9, 2016

CONTACT:        Kimmie Klaiman
                NEMS Commercial Buildings Analyst
                Kimberly.klaiman
		(202)586-1678

USED BY:        COMFloorspace subroutine of the National Energy Modeling System
                (NEMS) Commercial Demand Module (CDM)

DEFINITION:     Building vintages

                The median year of original construction for each
		floorspace vintage cohort group.  Currently there are 10
                vintage cohort groups, as shown in the table below.
                
                Vintage Cohort Groups
		--------------------
		Pre 1920
		1920-1945
		1946-1959
		1960-1969
		1970-1979
		1980-1989
		1990-1999
		2000-2003
		2004-2007
		2008-2012
                ---------------------
UNITS:          unitless

DIMENSION:      Building type, vintage cohort group, census division

SPECIAL CONSTRAINTS:    None

ORGANIZATION OF DATA:

                Data starts on row 101 of this file as per CDM convention.

                Each block corresponds to a building type, in the following
                order:  Assembly, Education, Food Sales, Food Service,
                Health Care, Lodging, Office-Large, Office-Small,
                Merc/Service, Warehouse, and Other.

                Each column corresponds to a vintage cohort group:
                Pre 1900, 1900-1919, 1920-1945, 1946-1959, 1960-1969, 1970-1979,
                1980-1989, 1990-1999, 2000-2003

                Each row corresponds to a Census Division, in the following order:
                New England, Middle Atlantic, East North Central, West North Central,
                South Atlantic, East South Central, West South Central, Mountain, and Pacific.

SOURCES:

                U.S. Department of Energy, Energy Information Administration, 2003 Commercial
                  Buildings Energy Consumption Survey, Public Use Data, available July 2012 at
                  http://www.eia.gov/emeu/cbecs/cbecs2003/public_use_2003/cbecs_pudata2003.html.
